Hanabi Tracker is used to keep track of clues in the award-winning cooperative deduction game Hanabi.

Title screen

From the title screen, choose the number of cards and multicolor option for each game.

Multicolor options:

  • None - Play without multicolor cards.
  • Distinct - Multicolor cards can be clued using the multicolor clue button.
  • All - Multicolor cards are all colors. Cards are marked with a multicolored icon in the lower right corner until they are known to not be multicolored.

Settings screen

Negative Info is inferred from clues that are given about other cards. For example, if you receive a clue that your first card is red, then your other cards are necessarily not red. This negative information can be hidden or displayed below each card.

Cards Shift Direction controls which way the cards move after a card is removed from your hand.

Play screen

There are two ways to mark cards with clues: 1) Tap one or more cards and then tap a clue, or 2) tap a clue and then tap one or more cards. Using the second option, the clue button will remain highlighted until another clue is selected.

When a card is played or discarded, tap the Remove button above the corresponding card. A new card is automatically added.

The Undo button will rollback clue or remove actions. The Undo button may be used repeatedly to undo multiple actions.

Card Annotation screen

Access the Annotation Screen by long-pressing a card. The Annotation screen allows you to update the positive or negative clue information for a card. Unlike entering normal clues, annotating a card will not affect the negative information of other cards. Use the annotation screen when you deduce information about a card or can eliminate possibilities for a card. In \"All\" multicolor mode, you can toggle the multicolor indicator icon on and off by setting the multicolor state to \"?\" and \"No.\"
